   110// WebhookPayload represents an incoming webhook
   111type WebhookPayload struct {
   112	ID        int               `json:"id"`
   113	Timestamp time.Time         `json:"timestamp"`
   114	Method    string            `json:"method"`
   115	Path      string            `json:"path"`
   116	Headers   map[string]string `json:"headers"`
   117	Body      string            `json:"body"`
   118	BodyJSON  interface{}       `json:"body_json,omitempty"`
   119}
   120
   121// State represents the current view/state of the application
   122type State int
   123
   124const (
   125	StateSetup State = iota
   126	StateRunning
   127	StateDetail
   128)
   129
   130// ViewMode represents how webhooks are displayed
   131type ViewMode int
   132
   133const (
   134	ViewModeList ViewMode = iota
   135	ViewModeTable
   136)
   137
   138// Model is the main application model
   139type Model struct {
   140	state          State
   141	portInput      textinput.Model
   142	subdomainInput textinput.Model
   143	timeoutInput   textinput.Model
   144	focusedInput   int
   145	spinner        spinner.Model
   146	viewport       viewport.Model

   154	tunnelError        string
   155	serverRunning      bool
   156	requestedPort      string
   157	requestedSubdomain string
   158	tunnelTimeout      time.Duration // how long before auto-shutdown
   159	tunnelStartTime    time.Time     // when tunnel was started
   160
   161	webhooks       []WebhookPayload
   162	webhooksMu     sync.Mutex
   163	selectedIdx    int
   164	webhookChan    chan WebhookPayload
   165	viewMode       ViewMode
   166
   167	// Pagination
   168	currentPage    int
   169	totalPages     int
   170	totalWebhooks  int
   171
   172	width          int
   173	height         int

   175	tunnelCmd      *exec.Cmd
   176
   177	// Search in detail view
   178	searchMode       bool
   179	searchInput      textinput.Model
   180	searchQuery      string
   181	searchMatches    []int  // line numbers with matches
   182	searchMatchIdx   int    // current match index
   183	detailContent    string // raw content for searching
   184	detailGutterWidth int   // gutter width for line numbers
   185}

   187// Messages
   188type publicIPMsg string
   189type publicIPErrMsg error
   190type tunnelStartedMsg struct {
   191	url string
   192	cmd *exec.Cmd
   193}
   194type tunnelErrorMsg string
   195type serverStartedMsg struct{}
   196type webhookReceivedMsg WebhookPayload
   197type webhooksLoadedMsg struct {
   198	webhooks      []WebhookPayload
   199	totalCount    int
   200	currentPage   int

   202type dbErrorMsg string
   203type tunnelExpiredMsg struct{}
   204
   205func initDB() error {
   206	if err := os.MkdirAll(filepath.Dir(dbPath), 0755); err != nil {
   207		return err
   208	}
   209
   210	var err error
   211	db, err = sql.Open("sqlite", dbPath)
   212	if err != nil {
   213		return err
   214	}
   215
   216	_, err = db.Exec(`
   217		CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS webhooks (
   218			id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
   219			timestamp DATETIME DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
   220			method TEXT,
   221			path TEXT,
   222			headers TEXT,
   223			body TEXT,
   224			body_json TEXT
   225		)
   226	`)
   227	return err
   228}
   229
   230func saveWebhookToDB(payload WebhookPayload) error {
   231	if db == nil {
   232		return fmt.Errorf("database not initialized")
   233	}
   234
   235	headersJSON, _ := json.Marshal(payload.Headers)
   236	bodyJSON := ""
   237	if payload.BodyJSON != nil {
   238		b, _ := json.Marshal(payload.BodyJSON)
   239		bodyJSON = string(b)
   240	}
   241
   242	// Store timestamp in RFC3339 format for consistent parsing
   243	_, err := db.Exec(`
   244		INSERT INTO webhooks (timestamp, method, path, headers, body, body_json)
   245		VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
   246	`, payload.Timestamp.Format(time.RFC3339), payload.Method, payload.Path, string(headersJSON), payload.Body, bodyJSON)
   247
   248	return err
   249}
   250
   251func loadWebhooksFromDB(page int) tea.Cmd {
   252	return func() tea.Msg {
   253		if db == nil {
   254			return dbErrorMsg("Database not initialized")
   255		}
   256
   257		// Get total count
   258		var totalCount int
   259		err := db.QueryRow("SELECT COUNT(*) FROM webhooks").Scan(&totalCount)
   260		if err != nil {
   261			return dbErrorMsg(fmt.Sprintf("Failed to count webhooks: %v", err))
   262		}
   263
   264		offset := page * pageSize
   265		rows, err := db.Query(`
   266			SELECT id, timestamp, method, path, headers, body, body_json
   267			FROM webhooks
   268			ORDER BY id DESC
   269			LIMIT ? OFFSET ?
   270		`, pageSize, offset)
   271		if err != nil {
   272			return dbErrorMsg(fmt.Sprintf("Failed to load webhooks: %v", err))
   273		}
   274		defer rows.Close()
   275
   276		var webhooks []WebhookPayload
   277		for rows.Next() {
   278			var w WebhookPayload
   279			var headersJSON, bodyJSON string
   280			var timestamp string
   281
   282			err := rows.Scan(&w.ID, &timestamp, &w.Method, &w.Path, &headersJSON, &w.Body, &bodyJSON)
   283			if err != nil {
   284				continue
   285			}
   286
   287			// Try multiple timestamp formats
   288			for _, format := range []string{
   289				time.RFC3339,
   290				"2006-01-02T15:04:05Z07:00",
   291				"2006-01-02 15:04:05",
   292				"2006-01-02T15:04:05",
   293			} {
   294				if t, err := time.Parse(format, timestamp); err == nil {
   295					w.Timestamp = t
   296					break
   297				}
   298			}
   299			json.Unmarshal([]byte(headersJSON), &w.Headers)
   300			if bodyJSON != "" {
   301				json.Unmarshal([]byte(bodyJSON), &w.BodyJSON)
   302			}
   303
   304			webhooks = append(webhooks, w)
   305		}
   306
   307		return webhooksLoadedMsg{
   308			webhooks:    webhooks,
   309			totalCount:  totalCount,
   310			currentPage: page,
   311		}
   312	}
   313}

   315func initialModel() Model {
   316	portInput := textinput.New()

   351		webhookChan:    make(chan WebhookPayload, 100),
   352		viewMode:       ViewModeTable, // Table view by default
   353		currentPage:    0,
   354		tunnelTimeout:  defaultTunnelTimeout,

   358
   359func (m Model) Init() tea.Cmd {
   360	return tea.Batch(
   361		textinput.Blink,
   362		m.spinner.Tick,
   363		fetchPublicIP,
   364		loadWebhooksFromDB(0), // Load previous webhooks on startup
   365	)
   366}
   367
   368// Commands
   369func fetchPublicIP() tea.Msg {
   370	resp, err := http.Get("https://api.ipify.org")
   371	if err != nil {
   372		// Try backup service
   373		resp, err = http.Get("https://ifconfig.me/ip")
   374		if err != nil {
   375			return publicIPErrMsg(err)
   376		}
   377	}
   378	defer resp.Body.Close()
   379
   380	body, err := io.ReadAll(resp.Body)
   381	if err != nil {
   382		return publicIPErrMsg(err)
   383	}
   384
   385	return publicIPMsg(strings.TrimSpace(string(body)))
   386}
   387
   388func startTunnel(port, subdomain string) tea.Cmd {
   389	return func() tea.Msg {
   390		args := []string{"localtunnel", "--port", port}
   391		if subdomain != "" {
   392			args = append(args, "--subdomain", subdomain)
   393		}
   394
   395		cmd := exec.Command("npx", args...)
   396		// Set process group so we can kill all children on exit
   397		cmd.SysProcAttr = &syscall.SysProcAttr{Setpgid: true}
   398		stdout, err := cmd.StdoutPipe()
   399		if err != nil {
   400			return tunnelErrorMsg(fmt.Sprintf("Failed to create stdout pipe: %v", err))
   401		}
   402
   403		if err := cmd.Start(); err != nil {
   404			return tunnelErrorMsg(fmt.Sprintf("Failed to start localtunnel: %v", err))
   405		}
   406
   407		// Read the URL from stdout
   408		buf := make([]byte, 1024)
   409		n, err := stdout.Read(buf)
   410		if err != nil {
   411			return tunnelErrorMsg(fmt.Sprintf("Failed to read tunnel URL: %v", err))
   412		}
   413
   414		output := string(buf[:n])
   415		// Parse out the URL from localtunnel output
   416		// Output typically looks like: "your url is: https://xxx.loca.lt"
   417		url := output
   418		if idx := strings.Index(output, "https://"); idx != -1 {
   419			url = strings.TrimSpace(output[idx:])
   420			if newline := strings.Index(url, "\n"); newline != -1 {
   421				url = url[:newline]
   422			}
   423		}
   424
   425		return tunnelStartedMsg{url: url, cmd: cmd}
   426	}
   427}
   428
   429func (m *Model) startWebhookServer() tea.Cmd {
   430	return func() tea.Msg {
   431		port := m.portInput.Value()
   432		if port == "" {
   433			port = "8098"
   434		}
   435
   436		webhookChan := m.webhookChan
   437		counter := 0
   438		counterMu := &sync.Mutex{}
   439
   440		http.HandleFunc("/", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
   441			body, err := io.ReadAll(r.Body)
   442			if err != nil {
   443				http.Error(w, "Failed to read body", http.StatusBadRequest)
   444				return
   445			}
   446			defer r.Body.Close()
   447
   448			counterMu.Lock()
   449			counter++
   450			id := counter
   451			counterMu.Unlock()
   452
   453			headers := make(map[string]string)
   454			for k, v := range r.Header {
   455				headers[k] = strings.Join(v, ", ")
   456			}
   457
   458			payload := WebhookPayload{
   459				ID:        id,
   460				Timestamp: time.Now(),
   461				Method:    r.Method,
   462				Path:      r.URL.Path,
   463				Headers:   headers,
   464				Body:      string(body),
   465			}
   466
   467			// Try to parse body as JSON for pretty display
   468			var jsonBody interface{}
   469			if err := json.Unmarshal(body, &jsonBody); err == nil {
   470				payload.BodyJSON = jsonBody
   471			}
   472
   473			// Save to database
   474			saveWebhookToDB(payload)
   475
   476			select {
   477			case webhookChan <- payload:
   478			default:
   479				// Channel full, drop oldest
   480			}
   481
   482			w.WriteHeader(http.StatusOK)
   483			w.Write([]byte("OK"))
   484		})
   485
   486		go func() {
   487			if err := http.ListenAndServe(":"+port, nil); err != nil {
   488				// Server error - in production we'd send this as a message
   489			}
   490		}()
   491
   492		return serverStartedMsg{}
   493	}
   494}
   495
   496func waitForWebhook(ch chan WebhookPayload) tea.Cmd {
   497	return func() tea.Msg {
   498		payload := <-ch
   499		return webhookReceivedMsg(payload)
   500	}
   501}

   503func scheduleTunnelExpiration(timeout time.Duration) tea.Cmd {
   504	return tea.Tick(timeout, func(t time.Time) tea.Msg {
   505		return tunnelExpiredMsg{}
   506	})
   507}
   508
   509func (m Model) Update(msg tea.Msg) (tea.Model, tea.Cmd) {
   510	var cmds []tea.Cmd
   511
   512	switch msg := msg.(type) {
   513	case tea.KeyMsg:
   514		// Handle search mode input first
   515		if m.searchMode {
   516			switch msg.String() {
   517			case "enter":
   518				// Execute search
   519				m.searchMode = false
   520				m.searchQuery = m.searchInput.Value()
   521				m.searchInput.Blur()
   522				if m.searchQuery != "" {
   523					m.findSearchMatches()
   524					m.updateDetailViewport() // Re-render with highlighting
   525					if len(m.searchMatches) > 0 {
   526						m.searchMatchIdx = 0
   527						m.viewport.SetYOffset(m.searchMatches[0])
   528					}
   529					cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   530				}
   531				return m, tea.Batch(cmds...)
   532			case "esc":
   533				// Cancel search
   534				m.searchMode = false
   535				m.searchInput.Blur()
   536				m.searchInput.SetValue("")
   537				// Clear highlighting
   538				m.searchQuery = ""
   539				m.searchMatches = nil
   540				m.updateDetailViewport()
   541				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   542				return m, tea.Batch(cmds...)
   543			default:
   544				// Pass to search input
   545				var cmd tea.Cmd
   546				m.searchInput, cmd = m.searchInput.Update(msg)
   547				return m, cmd
   548			}
   549		}
   550
   551		switch msg.String() {
   552		case "ctrl+c", "q":
   553			if m.tunnelCmd != nil && m.tunnelCmd.Process != nil {
   554				// Kill the process group to also kill child processes
   555				syscall.Kill(-m.tunnelCmd.Process.Pid, syscall.SIGTERM)
   556				m.tunnelCmd.Process.Kill()
   557			}
   558			return m, tea.Quit
   559
   560		case "tab", "shift+tab":
   561			if m.state == StateSetup {
   562				if msg.String() == "shift+tab" {
   563					m.focusedInput = (m.focusedInput + 2) % 3 // Go backwards
   564				} else {
   565					m.focusedInput = (m.focusedInput + 1) % 3
   566				}
   567				// Update focus states
   568				m.portInput.Blur()
   569				m.subdomainInput.Blur()
   570				m.timeoutInput.Blur()
   571				switch m.focusedInput {
   572				case 0:
   573					m.portInput.Focus()
   574				case 1:
   575					m.subdomainInput.Focus()
   576				case 2:
   577					m.timeoutInput.Focus()
   578				}
   579			}
   580
   581		case "enter":
   582			if m.state == StateSetup {
   583				m.state = StateRunning
   584				port := m.portInput.Value()
   585				if port == "" {
   586					port = "8098"
   587				}
   588				subdomain := m.subdomainInput.Value()
   589
   590				// Parse timeout (default 30 minutes)
   591				timeoutStr := m.timeoutInput.Value()
   592				if timeoutStr == "" {
   593					timeoutStr = "30"
   594				}
   595				if minutes, err := strconv.Atoi(timeoutStr); err == nil && minutes > 0 {
   596					m.tunnelTimeout = time.Duration(minutes) * time.Minute
   597				} else {
   598					m.tunnelTimeout = defaultTunnelTimeout
   599				}
   600
   601				// Store for display
   602				m.requestedPort = port
   603				m.requestedSubdomain = subdomain
   604				cmds = append(cmds, startTunnel(port, subdomain))
   605				cmds = append(cmds, m.startWebhookServer())
   606			} else if m.state == StateRunning && len(m.webhooks) > 0 {
   607				m.state = StateDetail
   608				// Set viewport content for the selected webhook
   609				content := m.buildDetailContent()
   610				// Calculate line number gutter width (4 digits + "  " = 7 chars)
   611				m.detailGutterWidth = 4
   612				gutterTotal := m.detailGutterWidth + 3 // "  "
   613				// Wrap content to viewport width minus gutter
   614				m.detailContent = wrapContent(content, m.viewport.Width-gutterTotal)
   615				// Clear any previous search
   616				m.searchQuery = ""
   617				m.searchMatches = nil
   618				m.searchMatchIdx = 0
   619				// Set viewport with line numbers
   620				m.updateDetailViewport()
   621				m.viewport.GotoTop()
   622			}
   623
   624		case "esc":
   625			if m.state == StateDetail {
   626				m.state = StateRunning
   627				// Clear search when leaving detail view
   628				m.searchQuery = ""
   629				m.searchMatches = nil
   630				m.searchMatchIdx = 0
   631			}
   632
   633		case "/":
   634			if m.state == StateDetail {
   635				m.searchMode = true
   636				m.searchInput.SetValue("")
   637				m.searchInput.Focus()
   638				return m, textinput.Blink
   639			}
   640
   641		case "N":
   642			if m.state == StateDetail && len(m.searchMatches) > 0 {
   643				// Previous match
   644				m.searchMatchIdx = (m.searchMatchIdx - 1 + len(m.searchMatches)) % len(m.searchMatches)
   645				m.viewport.SetYOffset(m.searchMatches[m.searchMatchIdx])
   646				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   647			}
   648
   649		case "up", "k":
   650			if m.state == StateRunning && m.selectedIdx > 0 {
   651				m.selectedIdx--
   652			} else if m.state == StateDetail {
   653				m.viewport.LineUp(1)
   654				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   655			}
   656
   657		case "down", "j":
   658			if m.state == StateRunning && m.selectedIdx < len(m.webhooks)-1 {
   659				m.selectedIdx++
   660			} else if m.state == StateDetail {
   661				m.viewport.LineDown(1)
   662				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   663			}
   664
   665		case "c":
   666			if m.state == StateRunning {
   667				m.webhooksMu.Lock()
   668				m.webhooks = make([]WebhookPayload, 0)
   669				m.selectedIdx = 0
   670				m.webhooksMu.Unlock()
   671			}
   672
   673		case "t":
   674			if m.state == StateRunning {
   675				if m.viewMode == ViewModeList {
   676					m.viewMode = ViewModeTable
   677				} else {
   678					m.viewMode = ViewModeList
   679				}
   680			}
   681
   682		case "l":
   683			if m.state == StateRunning {
   684				cmds = append(cmds, loadWebhooksFromDB(0))
   685			}
   686
   687		case "r":
   688			// Reconnect tunnel
   689			if m.state == StateRunning && (m.tunnelExpired || !m.tunnelRunning) {
   690				m.tunnelExpired = false
   691				m.tunnelError = ""
   692				cmds = append(cmds, startTunnel(m.requestedPort, m.requestedSubdomain))
   693			}
   694
   695		case "n":
   696			if m.state == StateDetail && len(m.searchMatches) > 0 {
   697				// Next search match
   698				m.searchMatchIdx = (m.searchMatchIdx + 1) % len(m.searchMatches)
   699				m.viewport.SetYOffset(m.searchMatches[m.searchMatchIdx])
   700				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   701			} else if m.state == StateRunning && m.currentPage < m.totalPages-1 {
   702				m.currentPage++
   703				cmds = append(cmds, loadWebhooksFromDB(m.currentPage))
   704			}
   705
   706		case "right":
   707			if m.state == StateRunning && m.currentPage < m.totalPages-1 {
   708				m.currentPage++
   709				cmds = append(cmds, loadWebhooksFromDB(m.currentPage))
   710			}
   711
   712		case "p", "left":
   713			if m.state == StateRunning && m.currentPage > 0 {
   714				m.currentPage--
   715				cmds = append(cmds, loadWebhooksFromDB(m.currentPage))
   716			}
   717
   718		case "pgup":
   719			if m.state == StateDetail {
   720				m.viewport.HalfViewUp()
   721				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   722			}
   723
   724		case "pgdown":
   725			if m.state == StateDetail {
   726				m.viewport.HalfViewDown()
   727				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   728			}
   729
   730		case "ctrl+f":
   731			if m.state == StateDetail {
   732				m.viewport.ViewDown()
   733				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   734			}
   735
   736		case "ctrl+b":
   737			if m.state == StateDetail {
   738				m.viewport.ViewUp()
   739				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   740			}
   741
   742		case "ctrl+d":
   743			if m.state == StateDetail {
   744				m.viewport.HalfViewDown()
   745				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   746			}
   747
   748		case "ctrl+u":
   749			if m.state == StateDetail {
   750				m.viewport.HalfViewUp()
   751				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   752			}
   753
   754		case "G":
   755			if m.state == StateDetail {
   756				m.viewport.GotoBottom()
   757				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   758			} else if m.state == StateRunning && len(m.webhooks) > 0 {
   759				m.selectedIdx = len(m.webhooks) - 1
   760			}
   761
   762		case "g":
   763			if m.state == StateDetail {
   764				m.viewport.GotoTop()
   765				cmds = append(cmds, viewport.Sync(m.viewport))
   766			} else if m.state == StateRunning && len(m.webhooks) > 0 {
   767				m.selectedIdx = 0
   768			}
   769		}
   770
   771	case tea.WindowSizeMsg:
   772		m.width = msg.Width
   773		m.height = msg.Height
   774		// Viewport height accounts for: header+blank (2) + blanks after viewport (2) + scroll indicator (1) + help (1) = 6 lines
   775		if !m.viewportReady {
   776			m.viewport = viewport.New(msg.Width-4, msg.Height-6)
   777			m.viewport.HighPerformanceRendering = false
   778			m.viewportReady = true
   779		} else {
   780			m.viewport.Width = msg.Width - 4
   781			m.viewport.Height = msg.Height - 6
   782		}
   783
   784	case publicIPMsg:
   785		m.publicIP = string(msg)
   786		m.fetchingIP = false
   787
   788	case publicIPErrMsg:
   789		m.publicIP = "Unable to fetch"
   790		m.fetchingIP = false
   791
   792	case tunnelStartedMsg:
   793		m.tunnelURL = msg.url
   794		m.tunnelCmd = msg.cmd
   795		m.tunnelRunning = true
   796		m.tunnelExpired = false
   797		m.tunnelStartTime = time.Now()
   798		// Schedule auto-shutdown
   799		cmds = append(cmds, scheduleTunnelExpiration(m.tunnelTimeout))
   800
   801	case tunnelExpiredMsg:
   802		if m.tunnelRunning && !m.tunnelExpired {
   803			// Kill the tunnel
   804			if m.tunnelCmd != nil && m.tunnelCmd.Process != nil {
   805				syscall.Kill(-m.tunnelCmd.Process.Pid, syscall.SIGTERM)
   806				m.tunnelCmd.Process.Kill()
   807			}
   808			m.tunnelRunning = false
   809			m.tunnelExpired = true
   810		}
   811
   812	case tunnelErrorMsg:
   813		m.tunnelError = string(msg)
   814
   815	case serverStartedMsg:
   816		m.serverRunning = true
   817		cmds = append(cmds, waitForWebhook(m.webhookChan))
   818
   819	case webhookReceivedMsg:
   820		m.webhooksMu.Lock()
   821		m.webhooks = append([]WebhookPayload{WebhookPayload(msg)}, m.webhooks...)
   822		m.webhooksMu.Unlock()
   823		cmds = append(cmds, waitForWebhook(m.webhookChan))
   824
   825	case webhooksLoadedMsg:
   826		m.webhooksMu.Lock()
   827		m.webhooks = msg.webhooks
   828		m.totalWebhooks = msg.totalCount
   829		m.currentPage = msg.currentPage
   830		m.totalPages = (msg.totalCount + pageSize - 1) / pageSize
   831		if m.totalPages == 0 {
   832			m.totalPages = 1
   833		}
   834		m.selectedIdx = 0
   835		m.webhooksMu.Unlock()
   836
   837	case dbErrorMsg:
   838		// Could show error in UI, for now just ignore
   839
   840	case spinner.TickMsg:
   841		var cmd tea.Cmd
   842		m.spinner, cmd = m.spinner.Update(msg)
   843		cmds = append(cmds, cmd)
   844	}
   845
   846	// Update ALL inputs - their internal Focus state controls which accepts keyboard input
   847	if m.state == StateSetup {
   848		var cmd tea.Cmd
   849		m.portInput, cmd = m.portInput.Update(msg)
   850		cmds = append(cmds, cmd)
   851		m.subdomainInput, cmd = m.subdomainInput.Update(msg)
   852		cmds = append(cmds, cmd)
   853		m.timeoutInput, cmd = m.timeoutInput.Update(msg)
   854		cmds = append(cmds, cmd)
   855	}
   856
   857	return m, tea.Batch(cmds...)
   858}

   860func (m Model) View() string {
   861	var b strings.Builder
   862
   863	// Title
   864	title := titleStyle.Render(" Webhook Listener TUI")
   865	b.WriteString(title + "\n\n")
   866
   867	switch m.state {
   868	case StateSetup:
   869		b.WriteString(m.viewSetup())
   870	case StateRunning:
   871		b.WriteString(m.viewRunning())
   872	case StateDetail:
   873		b.WriteString(m.viewDetail())
   874	}
   875
   876	return b.String()
   877}

   879func (m Model) viewSetup() string {
   880	var b strings.Builder
   881
   882	// Public IP section
   883	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Public IP Address") + "\n")
   884	if m.fetchingIP {
   885		b.WriteString(m.spinner.View() + " Fetching...\n")
   886	} else {
   887		b.WriteString(highlightStyle.Render(m.publicIP) + "\n")
   888		b.WriteString(infoStyle.Render("(Use this for webhook authentication if needed)") + "\n")
   889	}
   890	b.WriteString("\n")
   891
   892	// Port input
   893	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Local Port") + "\n")
   894	if m.focusedInput == 0 {
   895		b.WriteString(selectedStyle.Render(m.portInput.View()) + "\n")
   896	} else {
   897		b.WriteString(m.portInput.View() + "\n")
   898	}
   899	b.WriteString(infoStyle.Render("Port for the local webhook server") + "\n\n")
   900
   901	// Subdomain input
   902	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Subdomain (optional)") + "\n")
   903	if m.focusedInput == 1 {
   904		b.WriteString(selectedStyle.Render(m.subdomainInput.View()) + "\n")
   905	} else {
   906		b.WriteString(m.subdomainInput.View() + "\n")
   907	}
   908	b.WriteString(infoStyle.Render("Custom subdomain for localtunnel (e.g., my-app  my-app.loca.lt)") + "\n\n")
   909
   910	// Timeout input
   911	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Tunnel Timeout (minutes)") + "\n")
   912	if m.focusedInput == 2 {
   913		b.WriteString(selectedStyle.Render(m.timeoutInput.View()) + "\n")
   914	} else {
   915		b.WriteString(m.timeoutInput.View() + "\n")
   916	}
   917	b.WriteString(infoStyle.Render("Auto-disconnect tunnel after this many minutes (default: 30)") + "\n\n")
   918
   919	// Help
   920	b.WriteString(helpStyle.Render("Tab: switch fields  Enter: start  q: quit"))
   921
   922	return b.String()
   923}

   925func (m Model) viewRunning() string {
   926	var b strings.Builder
   927
   928	// Status section
   929	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Status") + "\n")
   930
   931	// Public IP
   932	b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Public IP: %s\n", highlightStyle.Render(m.publicIP)))
   933
   934	// Server status
   935	if m.serverRunning {
   936		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Server: %s on port %s\n", successStyle.Render(""), m.requestedPort))
   937	} else {
   938		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Server: %s Starting...\n", m.spinner.View()))
   939	}
   940
   941	// Tunnel status
   942	if m.tunnelError != "" {
   943		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Tunnel: %s %s\n", errorStyle.Render(""), m.tunnelError))
   944	} else if m.tunnelExpired {
   945		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Tunnel: %s (auto-shutdown after %v) - press 'r' to reconnect\n",
   946			errorStyle.Render(" DISCONNECTED"), m.tunnelTimeout))
   947		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Last URL: %s\n", infoStyle.Render(m.tunnelURL)))
   948	} else if m.tunnelRunning {
   949		// Calculate time remaining
   950		elapsed := time.Since(m.tunnelStartTime)
   951		remaining := m.tunnelTimeout - elapsed
   952		if remaining < 0 {
   953			remaining = 0
   954		}
   955		minutes := int(remaining.Minutes())
   956		seconds := int(remaining.Seconds()) % 60
   957		remainingStr := fmt.Sprintf("%02d:%02d", minutes, seconds)
   958
   959		// Color the countdown based on time remaining
   960		countdownStyle := successStyle
   961		if remaining < 5*time.Minute {
   962			countdownStyle = lipgloss.NewStyle().Foreground(lipgloss.Color("214")) // Orange/yellow
   963		}
   964		if remaining < 1*time.Minute {
   965			countdownStyle = errorStyle // Red
   966		}
   967
   968		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Tunnel: %s %s\n", successStyle.Render(""), m.tunnelURL))
   969		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Webhook URL: %s\n", highlightStyle.Render(m.tunnelURL+"/webhook")))
   970		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Expires in: %s\n", countdownStyle.Render(remainingStr)))
   971	} else {
   972		subdomainInfo := ""
   973		if m.requestedSubdomain != "" {
   974			subdomainInfo = fmt.Sprintf(" (subdomain: %s)", m.requestedSubdomain)
   975		}
   976		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  Tunnel: %s Starting localtunnel...%s\n", m.spinner.View(), subdomainInfo))
   977	}
   978	b.WriteString("\n")
   979
   980	// View mode indicator
   981	viewModeStr := "List"
   982	if m.viewMode == ViewModeTable {
   983		viewModeStr = "Table"
   984	}
   985	// Show total count if loaded from DB, otherwise show current count
   986	countStr := fmt.Sprintf("%d", len(m.webhooks))
   987	if m.totalWebhooks > 0 {
   988		countStr = fmt.Sprintf("%d total", m.totalWebhooks)
   989	}
   990	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render(fmt.Sprintf("Webhooks (%s)", countStr)))
   991
   992	// Pagination and view mode info
   993	pageInfo := ""
   994	if m.totalPages > 1 {
   995		pageInfo = fmt.Sprintf(" Page %d/%d |", m.currentPage+1, m.totalPages)
   996	}
   997	b.WriteString(infoStyle.Render(fmt.Sprintf("%s [%s]", pageInfo, viewModeStr)) + "\n")
   998
   999	if len(m.webhooks) == 0 {
  1000		b.WriteString(infoStyle.Render("  Waiting for webhooks...") + "\n")
  1001	} else if m.viewMode == ViewModeTable {
  1002		b.WriteString(m.renderTableView())
  1003	} else {
  1004		b.WriteString(m.renderListView())
  1005	}
  1006
  1007	// Help
  1008	b.WriteString("\n" + helpStyle.Render("j/k: select  n/p: page  Enter: details  t: view  r: reconnect  l: load DB  c: clear  q: quit"))
  1009
  1010	return b.String()
  1011}

  1013func (m Model) renderListView() string {
  1014	var b strings.Builder
  1015
  1016	maxShow := 10
  1017	if len(m.webhooks) < maxShow {
  1018		maxShow = len(m.webhooks)
  1019	}
  1020
  1021	for i := 0; i < maxShow; i++ {
  1022		wh := m.webhooks[i]
  1023		preview := truncate(wh.Body, 50)
  1024		if preview == "" {
  1025			preview = "(empty body)"
  1026		}
  1027
  1028		item := fmt.Sprintf("#%d %s %s %s\n    %s",
  1029			wh.ID,
  1030			wh.Timestamp.Format("15:04:05"),
  1031			methodStyle(wh.Method),
  1032			wh.Path,
  1033			infoStyle.Render(preview),
  1034		)
  1035
  1036		if i == m.selectedIdx {
  1037			b.WriteString(webhookSelectedStyle.Render(item) + "\n")
  1038		} else {
  1039			b.WriteString(webhookItemStyle.Render(item) + "\n")
  1040		}
  1041	}
  1042
  1043	return b.String()
  1044}

  1046func (m Model) renderTableView() string {
  1047	var b strings.Builder
  1048
  1049	// Table header
  1050	tableHeaderStyle := lipgloss.NewStyle().
  1051		Bold(true).
  1052		Foreground(lipgloss.Color("39")).
  1053		BorderStyle(lipgloss.NormalBorder()).
  1054		BorderBottom(true).
  1055		BorderForeground(lipgloss.Color("240"))
  1056
  1057	// Column widths
  1058	idW := 4
  1059	timeW := 10
  1060	methodW := 8
  1061	pathW := 20
  1062	bodyW := 40
  1063
  1064	header := fmt.Sprintf("%-*s %-*s %-*s %-*s %-*s",
  1065		idW, "ID",
  1066		timeW, "Time",
  1067		methodW, "Method",
  1068		pathW, "Path",
  1069		bodyW, "Body Preview",
  1070	)
  1071	b.WriteString(tableHeaderStyle.Render(header) + "\n")
  1072
  1073	// Table rows
  1074	maxShow := 15
  1075	if len(m.webhooks) < maxShow {
  1076		maxShow = len(m.webhooks)
  1077	}
  1078
  1079	for i := 0; i < maxShow; i++ {
  1080		wh := m.webhooks[i]
  1081		preview := truncate(wh.Body, bodyW-3)
  1082		if preview == "" {
  1083			preview = "(empty)"
  1084		}
  1085		path := truncate(wh.Path, pathW-3)
  1086
  1087		row := fmt.Sprintf("%-*d %-*s %-*s %-*s %-*s",
  1088			idW, wh.ID,
  1089			timeW, wh.Timestamp.Format("15:04:05"),
  1090			methodW, wh.Method,
  1091			pathW, path,
  1092			bodyW, preview,
  1093		)
  1094
  1095		if i == m.selectedIdx {
  1096			rowStyle := lipgloss.NewStyle().
  1097				Background(lipgloss.Color("236")).
  1098				Foreground(lipgloss.Color("212"))
  1099			b.WriteString(rowStyle.Render(row) + "\n")
  1100		} else {
  1101			// Color-code method in row
  1102			methodColored := methodStyle(wh.Method)
  1103			row = fmt.Sprintf("%-*d %-*s %s%s %-*s %-*s",
  1104				idW, wh.ID,
  1105				timeW, wh.Timestamp.Format("15:04:05"),
  1106				methodColored, strings.Repeat(" ", methodW-len(wh.Method)),
  1107				pathW, path,
  1108				bodyW, preview,
  1109			)
  1110			b.WriteString(row + "\n")
  1111		}
  1112	}
  1113
  1114	return b.String()
  1115}
  1116
  1117func (m Model) buildDetailContent() string {
  1118	var b strings.Builder
  1119
  1120	if m.selectedIdx >= len(m.webhooks) {
  1121		return "No webhook selected"
  1122	}
  1123
  1124	wh := m.webhooks[m.selectedIdx]
  1125
  1126	// Metadata
  1127	b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("%s %s\n",
  1128		highlightStyle.Render("Method:"),
  1129		methodStyle(wh.Method),
  1130	))
  1131	b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("%s %s\n", highlightStyle.Render("Path:"), wh.Path))
  1132	b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("%s %s\n\n", highlightStyle.Render("Time:"), wh.Timestamp.Format(time.RFC3339)))
  1133
  1134	// Headers
  1135	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Headers") + "\n")
  1136	for k, v := range wh.Headers {
  1137		b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  %s: %s\n", highlightStyle.Render(k), v))
  1138	}
  1139	b.WriteString("\n")
  1140
  1141	// Body
  1142	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Body") + "\n")
  1143	if wh.BodyJSON != nil {
  1144		prettyJSON, err := json.MarshalIndent(wh.BodyJSON, "", "  ")
  1145		if err == nil {
  1146			b.WriteString(highlightJSON(string(prettyJSON)) + "\n")
  1147		} else {
  1148			b.WriteString(bodyStyle.Render(wh.Body) + "\n")
  1149		}
  1150	} else if wh.Body != "" {
  1151		b.WriteString(bodyStyle.Render(wh.Body) + "\n")
  1152	} else {
  1153		b.WriteString(infoStyle.Render("(empty)") + "\n")
  1154	}
  1155
  1156	return b.String()
  1157}

  1159func (m Model) viewDetail() string {
  1160	var b strings.Builder
  1161
  1162	if m.selectedIdx >= len(m.webhooks) {
  1163		return "No webhook selected"
  1164	}
  1165
  1166	wh := m.webhooks[m.selectedIdx]
  1167
  1168	// Header
  1169	b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render(fmt.Sprintf("Webhook #%d Details", wh.ID)) + "\n\n")
  1170
  1171	// Viewport with scrollable content
  1172	b.WriteString(m.viewport.View() + "\n\n")
  1173
  1174	// Scroll indicator with optional search info
  1175	scrollPercent := int(m.viewport.ScrollPercent() * 100)
  1176	var scrollInfo string
  1177	if m.searchQuery != "" && len(m.searchMatches) > 0 {
  1178		scrollInfo = infoStyle.Render(fmt.Sprintf(" %d%%  match %d/%d for '%s' ",
  1179			scrollPercent, m.searchMatchIdx+1, len(m.searchMatches), m.searchQuery))
  1180	} else if m.searchQuery != "" {
  1181		scrollInfo = infoStyle.Render(fmt.Sprintf(" %d%%  no matches for '%s' ",
  1182			scrollPercent, m.searchQuery))
  1183	} else {
  1184		scrollInfo = infoStyle.Render(fmt.Sprintf(" %d%% ", scrollPercent))
  1185	}
  1186	b.WriteString(scrollInfo + "\n")
  1187
  1188	// Help or search input
  1189	if m.searchMode {
  1190		b.WriteString(m.searchInput.View())
  1191	} else {
  1192		b.WriteString(helpStyle.Render("//j/k: scroll  /: search  n/N: next/prev  g/G: top/bottom  Esc: back"))
  1193	}
  1194
  1195	return b.String()
  1196}
  1197
  1198// findSearchMatches finds all lines containing the search query
  1199func (m *Model) findSearchMatches() {
  1200	m.searchMatches = nil
  1201	if m.searchQuery == "" || m.detailContent == "" {
  1202		return
  1203	}
  1204
  1205	lines := strings.Split(m.detailContent, "\n")
  1206	query := strings.ToLower(m.searchQuery)
  1207
  1208	for i, line := range lines {
  1209		// Strip ANSI codes for searching
  1210		cleanLine := stripANSI(line)
  1211		if strings.Contains(strings.ToLower(cleanLine), query) {
  1212			m.searchMatches = append(m.searchMatches, i)
  1213		}
  1214	}
  1215}
  1216
  1217// updateDetailViewport updates the viewport content with line numbers and search highlighting
  1218func (m *Model) updateDetailViewport() {
  1219	if m.detailContent == "" {
  1220		return
  1221	}
  1222
  1223	var content string
  1224	if m.searchQuery != "" {
  1225		content = highlightSearchMatches(m.detailContent, m.searchQuery)
  1226	} else {
  1227		content = m.detailContent
  1228	}
  1229
  1230	numbered := addLineNumbers(content, m.detailGutterWidth)
  1231	m.viewport.SetContent(numbered)
  1232}
  1233
  1234// highlightSearchMatches highlights all occurrences of query in the content
  1235func highlightSearchMatches(content, query string) string {
  1236	if query == "" {
  1237		return content
  1238	}
  1239
  1240	lines := strings.Split(content, "\n")
  1241	var result strings.Builder
  1242
  1243	for i, line := range lines {
  1244		result.WriteString(highlightLineMatches(line, query))
  1245		if i < len(lines)-1 {
  1246			result.WriteString("\n")
  1247		}
  1248	}
  1249
  1250	return result.String()
  1251}
  1252
  1253// highlightLineMatches highlights matches in a single line (case-insensitive)
  1254func highlightLineMatches(line, query string) string {
  1255	if query == "" {
  1256		return line
  1257	}
  1258
  1259	lowerLine := strings.ToLower(stripANSI(line))
  1260	lowerQuery := strings.ToLower(query)
  1261
  1262	// If no match in this line, return as-is
  1263	if !strings.Contains(lowerLine, lowerQuery) {
  1264		return line
  1265	}
  1266
  1267	// For lines with ANSI codes, we need to be careful
  1268	// Simple approach: find matches in clean text, then highlight in original
  1269	// This is tricky with ANSI codes, so let's do a simpler approach:
  1270	// Replace matches case-insensitively
  1271	var result strings.Builder
  1272	remaining := line
  1273
  1274	for len(remaining) > 0 {
  1275		// Find next match (case-insensitive) in the remaining string
  1276		cleanRemaining := strings.ToLower(stripANSI(remaining))
  1277		idx := strings.Index(cleanRemaining, lowerQuery)
  1278
  1279		if idx == -1 {
  1280			result.WriteString(remaining)
  1281			break
  1282		}
  1283
  1284		// Find the actual position in the string with ANSI codes
  1285		actualIdx := findActualIndex(remaining, idx)
  1286
  1287		// Write everything before the match
  1288		result.WriteString(remaining[:actualIdx])
  1289
  1290		// Find the end of the match (accounting for ANSI codes)
  1291		matchEnd := findActualIndex(remaining, idx+len(query))
  1292
  1293		// Extract and highlight the match
  1294		match := remaining[actualIdx:matchEnd]
  1295		result.WriteString(searchHighlightStyle.Render(stripANSI(match)))
  1296
  1297		remaining = remaining[matchEnd:]
  1298	}
  1299
  1300	return result.String()
  1301}
  1302
  1303// findActualIndex finds the actual byte index in a string with ANSI codes
  1304// given a visual character index (ignoring ANSI codes)
  1305func findActualIndex(s string, visualIdx int) int {
  1306	ansiPattern := regexp.MustCompile(`\x1b\[[0-9;]*m`)
  1307
  1308	actualIdx := 0
  1309	visualCount := 0
  1310
  1311	for actualIdx < len(s) && visualCount < visualIdx {
  1312		// Check if we're at the start of an ANSI sequence
  1313		if loc := ansiPattern.FindStringIndex(s[actualIdx:]); loc != nil && loc[0] == 0 {
  1314			// Skip the ANSI sequence
  1315			actualIdx += loc[1]
  1316		} else {
  1317			// Regular character
  1318			actualIdx++
  1319			visualCount++
  1320		}
  1321	}
  1322
  1323	return actualIdx
  1324}
  1325
  1326// stripANSI removes ANSI escape codes from a string
  1327func stripANSI(s string) string {
  1328	ansiPattern := regexp.MustCompile(`\x1b\[[0-9;]*m`)
  1329	return ansiPattern.ReplaceAllString(s, "")
  1330}
  1331
  1332// wrapContent wraps text to the specified width while preserving ANSI escape codes
  1333func wrapContent(content string, width int) string {
  1334	// wrap.String is ANSI-aware and will hard-wrap at the specified width
  1335	return wrap.String(content, width)
  1336}
  1337
  1338// highlightJSON applies syntax highlighting to JSON text
  1339func highlightJSON(jsonStr string) string {
  1340	var result strings.Builder
  1341	lines := strings.Split(jsonStr, "\n")
  1342
  1343	for i, line := range lines {
  1344		result.WriteString(highlightJSONLine(line))
  1345		if i < len(lines)-1 {
  1346			result.WriteString("\n")
  1347		}
  1348	}
  1349
  1350	return result.String()
  1351}
  1352
  1353// highlightJSONLine highlights a single line of JSON
  1354func highlightJSONLine(line string) string {
  1355	trimmed := strings.TrimSpace(line)
  1356	indent := line[:len(line)-len(trimmed)]
  1357
  1358	// Empty or whitespace-only line
  1359	if trimmed == "" {
  1360		return line
  1361	}
  1362
  1363	// Bracket-only lines
  1364	if trimmed == "{" || trimmed == "}" || trimmed == "[" || trimmed == "]" ||
  1365		trimmed == "{," || trimmed == "}," || trimmed == "[," || trimmed == "]," {
  1366		bracket := strings.TrimSuffix(trimmed, ",")
  1367		comma := ""
  1368		if strings.HasSuffix(trimmed, ",") {
  1369			comma = ","
  1370		}
  1371		return indent + jsonBracketStyle.Render(bracket) + comma
  1372	}
  1373
  1374	// Check if line has a key (starts with ")
  1375	if strings.HasPrefix(trimmed, "\"") {
  1376		colonIdx := strings.Index(trimmed, "\":")
  1377		if colonIdx > 0 {
  1378			// This is a key: value line
  1379			key := trimmed[:colonIdx+1]
  1380			rest := trimmed[colonIdx+2:] // skip ":
  1381
  1382			var result strings.Builder
  1383			result.WriteString(indent)
  1384			result.WriteString(jsonKeyStyle.Render(key))
  1385			result.WriteString(": ")
  1386
  1387			value := strings.TrimSpace(rest)
  1388			result.WriteString(highlightJSONValue(value))
  1389			return result.String()
  1390		}
  1391	}
  1392
  1393	// Array element (string, number, etc.)
  1394	return indent + highlightJSONValue(trimmed)
  1395}
  1396
  1397// highlightJSONValue highlights a JSON value
  1398func highlightJSONValue(value string) string {
  1399	// Remove trailing comma for analysis
  1400	hasComma := strings.HasSuffix(value, ",")
  1401	cleanValue := strings.TrimSuffix(value, ",")
  1402	comma := ""
  1403	if hasComma {
  1404		comma = ","
  1405	}
  1406
  1407	// String value
  1408	if strings.HasPrefix(cleanValue, "\"") && strings.HasSuffix(cleanValue, "\"") {
  1409		return jsonStringStyle.Render(cleanValue) + comma
  1410	}
  1411
  1412	// Boolean
  1413	if cleanValue == "true" || cleanValue == "false" {
  1414		return jsonBoolStyle.Render(cleanValue) + comma
  1415	}
  1416
  1417	// Null
  1418	if cleanValue == "null" {
  1419		return jsonNullStyle.Render(cleanValue) + comma
  1420	}
  1421
  1422	// Number (int or float)
  1423	if regexp.MustCompile(`^-?\d+\.?\d*([eE][+-]?\d+)?$`).MatchString(cleanValue) {
  1424		return jsonNumberStyle.Render(cleanValue) + comma
  1425	}
  1426
  1427	// Array/object start
  1428	if cleanValue == "[" || cleanValue == "{" {
  1429		return jsonBracketStyle.Render(cleanValue) + comma
  1430	}
  1431
  1432	// Default - return as-is
  1433	return value
  1434}
  1435
  1436// addLineNumbers adds vim-style line numbers to content
  1437func addLineNumbers(content string, gutterWidth int) string {
  1438	lines := strings.Split(content, "\n")
  1439	var result strings.Builder
  1440
  1441	for i, line := range lines {
  1442		lineNum := fmt.Sprintf("%*d", gutterWidth, i+1)
  1443		result.WriteString(lineNumberStyle.Render(lineNum))
  1444		result.WriteString("  ")
  1445		result.WriteString(line)
  1446		if i < len(lines)-1 {
  1447			result.WriteString("\n")
  1448		}
  1449	}
  1450
  1451	return result.String()
  1452}
  1453
  1454func methodStyle(method string) string {
  1455	switch method {
  1456	case "GET":
  1457		return lipgloss.NewStyle().Foreground(lipgloss.Color("82")).Render("GET")
  1458	case "POST":
  1459		return lipgloss.NewStyle().Foreground(lipgloss.Color("39")).Render("POST")
  1460	case "PUT":
  1461		return lipgloss.NewStyle().Foreground(lipgloss.Color("214")).Render("PUT")
  1462	case "DELETE":
  1463		return lipgloss.NewStyle().Foreground(lipgloss.Color("196")).Render("DELETE")
  1464	case "PATCH":
  1465		return lipgloss.NewStyle().Foreground(lipgloss.Color("141")).Render("PATCH")
  1466	default:
  1467		return method
  1468	}
  1469}
  1470
  1471func truncate(s string, max int) string {
  1472	s = strings.ReplaceAll(s, "\n", " ")
  1473	s = strings.ReplaceAll(s, "\r", "")
  1474	if len(s) <= max {
  1475		return s
  1476	}
  1477	return s[:max] + "..."
  1478}
  1479
  1480func main() {
  1481	// Initialize database
  1482	if err := initDB(); err != nil {
  1483		fmt.Printf("Failed to initialize database: %v\n", err)
  1484		os.Exit(1)
  1485	}
  1486	defer db.Close()

  1488	p := tea.NewProgram(initialModel(), tea.WithAltScreen())
  1489	if _, err := p.Run(); err != nil {
  1490		fmt.Printf("Error running program: %v\n", err)
  1491		os.Exit(1)
  1492	}
  1493}

Explore this webhook TUI codebase to find the pager/viewport implementation used for displaying webhook details. I'm looking for:
1. How the pager/viewport renders content
2. How lines are calculated for display
3. Any code related to the detail view that shows headers and body content

Look at the project structure first, then find the relevant pager/viewport code. Focus on anything that could cause duplicate/repeating lines in the display.

Excellent! I've found the webhook TUI codebase. This is a Go project using Bubble Tea (a TUI framework) with a viewport component. Let me analyze the key areas related to the pager/viewport implementation:

## Summary of Findings

### 1. **Viewport/Pager Implementation**

The codebase uses the **Charmbracelet Bubbles viewport** library (line 21):
```go
"github.com/charmbracelet/bubbles/viewport"
```

The viewport is defined in the Model struct (lines 146-147):
```go
viewport       viewport.Model
viewportReady  bool
```

### 2. **How the Viewport Renders Content**

**Lines 1159-1196 (`viewDetail()` function):**
- Renders the detail view header: `"Webhook #%d Details"`
- Calls `m.viewport.View()` to render the actual scrollable content
- Shows scroll percentage indicator with search information
- Includes help text or search input

**Key viewport operations in the Update function:**
- Line 627: `m.viewport.SetContent(numbered)` - Sets content with line numbers
- Line 776: `m.viewport = viewport.New(msg.Width-4, msg.Height-6)` - Initializes viewport
- Lines 780-781: Updates viewport dimensions on window resize

### 3. **How Lines Are Calculated for Display**

**Lines 1436-1452 (`addLineNumbers()` function):**
```go
func addLineNumbers(content string, gutterWidth int) string {
	lines := strings.Split(content, "\n")
	var result strings.Builder

	for i, line := range lines {
		lineNum := fmt.Sprintf("%*d", gutterWidth, i+1)
		result.WriteString(lineNumberStyle.Render(lineNum))
		result.WriteString("  ")
		result.WriteString(line)
		if i < len(lines)-1 {
			result.WriteString("\n")
		}
	}

	return result.String()
}
```

**IMPORTANT FINDING - POTENTIAL DUPLICATE LINE SOURCE:**

The line calculation process:
1. **Line 611-614 (Enter key handler for detail view):**
   ```go
   m.detailGutterWidth = 4
   gutterTotal := m.detailGutterWidth + 3 // "  "
   m.detailContent = wrapContent(content, m.viewport.Width-gutterTotal)
   ```
   - Sets gutter width to 4
   - Calculates total gutter space as 7 (4 + 3 for "  ")

2. **Line 1230:** Calls `addLineNumbers(content, m.detailGutterWidth)`

3. **Lines 1437-1451:** The `addLineNumbers()` function:
   - Splits content by newlines
   - For each line, writes: `[line_number] [] [line_content]`
   - **CRITICAL**: Line 1446-1448: `if i < len(lines)-1 { result.WriteString("\n") }`
     - This SKIPS the newline for the LAST line

### 4. **Detail View Content Construction**

**Lines 1117-1157 (`buildDetailContent()` function):**
```go
// Metadata section
b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("%s %s\n", highlightStyle.Render("Method:"), methodStyle(wh.Method)))
b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("%s %s\n", highlightStyle.Render("Path:"), wh.Path))
b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("%s %s\n\n", highlightStyle.Render("Time:"), wh.Timestamp.Format(time.RFC3339)))

// Headers section
b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Headers") + "\n")
for k, v := range wh.Headers {
    b.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  %s: %s\n", highlightStyle.Render(k), v))
}
b.WriteString("\n")

// Body section
b.WriteString(headerStyle.Render("Body") + "\n")
// ... body content ...
```

### 5. **Content Wrapping**

**Lines 1332-1336 (`wrapContent()` function):**
```go
func wrapContent(content string, width int) string {
	return wrap.String(content, width)
}
```

Uses `muesli/reflow/wrap` library (line 24) for ANSI-aware wrapping.

### 6. **Viewport Setup During Resize**

**Lines 771-782 (WindowSizeMsg handler):**
```go
case tea.WindowSizeMsg:
	m.width = msg.Width
	m.height = msg.Height
	if !m.viewportReady {
		m.viewport = viewport.New(msg.Width-4, msg.Height-6)
		m.viewport.HighPerformanceRendering = false
		m.viewportReady = true
	} else {
		m.viewport.Width = msg.Width - 4
		m.viewport.Height = msg.Height - 6
	}
```

**Key dimensions:**
- Viewport width: `Window Width - 4`
- Viewport height: `Window Height - 6` (accounting for header, footer, scroll indicator, help)

---

## Files and Code Snippets Summary

**File:** `/Users/sorrell/src/tools/webhook-tui/main.go`

**Key functions for pager/viewport:**
1. **`viewDetail()` (lines 1159-1196)** - Main detail view rendering
2. **`updateDetailViewport()` (lines 1217-1232)** - Sets viewport content with line numbers
3. **`addLineNumbers()` (lines 1436-1452)** - Adds line numbers to content
4. **`buildDetailContent()` (lines 1117-1157)** - Builds the detail view content
5. **`wrapContent()` (lines 1332-1336)** - Wraps content to width
6. **Update() handler (lines 509-858)** - Handles viewport operations

**Critical viewport fields:**
- `Model.viewport` - The viewport.Model instance
- `Model.detailContent` - Raw wrapped content (with styling)
- `Model.detailGutterWidth` - Width of line number gutter (4)
- `Model.width / Model.height` - Terminal dimensions

The pager/viewport implementation is straightforward and uses the Charmbracelet Bubbles library's built-in viewport model, which handles scrolling, line tracking, and rendering efficiently.

func (m Model) View() string {
	if m.HighPerformanceRendering {
		return strings.Repeat("\n", max(0, m.Height-1))
	}

	w, h := m.Width, m.Height
	if sw := m.Style.GetWidth(); sw != 0 {
		w = min(w, sw)
	}
	if sh := m.Style.GetHeight(); sh != 0 {
		h = min(h, sh)
	}
	contentWidth := w - m.Style.GetHorizontalFrameSize()
	contentHeight := h - m.Style.GetVerticalFrameSize()
	contents := lipgloss.NewStyle().

		Height(contentHeight).    // pad to height.
		MaxHeight(contentHeight). // truncate height if taller.

Found it! The issue is that the code calls `viewport.Sync(m.viewport)` after every scroll/search operation, but `viewport.Sync` is explicitly documented as **"For high performance rendering only."** (line 244 of viewport.go). Since your viewport has `HighPerformanceRendering = false`, calling `Sync` causes `tea.SyncScrollArea` to re-render the visible lines in a terminal scroll region, conflicting with the normal renderer  resulting in duplicate lines.

The fix is to remove all the `viewport.Sync` calls. The normal renderer already re-renders the viewport automatically when the model changes.

1package tea
     2
     3import (
     4	"bytes"
     5	"fmt"
     6	"io"
     7	"strings"
     8	"sync"
     9	"time"
    10
    11	"github.com/muesli/ansi/compressor"
    12	"github.com/muesli/reflow/truncate"
    13	"github.com/muesli/termenv"
    14)
    15
    16const (
    17	// defaultFramerate specifies the maximum interval at which we should
    18	// update the view.
    19	defaultFPS = 60
    20	maxFPS     = 120
    21)
    22
    23// standardRenderer is a framerate-based terminal renderer, updating the view
    24// at a given framerate to avoid overloading the terminal emulator.
    25//
    26// In cases where very high performance is needed the renderer can be told
    27// to exclude ranges of lines, allowing them to be written to directly.
    28type standardRenderer struct {
    29	mtx *sync.Mutex
    30	out *termenv.Output
    31
    32	buf                bytes.Buffer
    33	queuedMessageLines []string
    34	framerate          time.Duration
    35	ticker             *time.Ticker
    36	done               chan struct{}
    37	lastRender         string
    38	linesRendered      int
    39	useANSICompressor  bool
    40	once               sync.Once
    41
    42	// cursor visibility state
    43	cursorHidden bool
    44
    45	// essentially whether or not we're using the full size of the terminal
    46	altScreenActive bool
    47
    48	// renderer dimensions; usually the size of the window
    49	width  int
    50	height int
    51
    52	// lines explicitly set not to render
    53	ignoreLines map[int]struct{}
    54}
    55
    56// newRenderer creates a new renderer. Normally you'll want to initialize it
    57// with os.Stdout as the first argument.
    58func newRenderer(out *termenv.Output, useANSICompressor bool, fps int) renderer {
    59	if fps < 1 {
    60		fps = defaultFPS
    61	} else if fps > maxFPS {
    62		fps = maxFPS
    63	}
    64	r := &standardRenderer{
    65		out:                out,
    66		mtx:                &sync.Mutex{},
    67		done:               make(chan struct{}),
    68		framerate:          time.Second / time.Duration(fps),
    69		useANSICompressor:  useANSICompressor,
    70		queuedMessageLines: []string{},
    71	}
    72	if r.useANSICompressor {
    73		r.out = termenv.NewOutput(&compressor.Writer{Forward: out})
    74	}
    75	return r
    76}
    77
    78// start starts the renderer.
    79func (r *standardRenderer) start() {
    80	if r.ticker == nil {
    81		r.ticker = time.NewTicker(r.framerate)
    82	} else {
    83		// If the ticker already exists, it has been stopped and we need to
    84		// reset it.
    85		r.ticker.Reset(r.framerate)
    86	}
    87
    88	// Since the renderer can be restarted after a stop, we need to reset
    89	// the done channel and its corresponding sync.Once.
    90	r.once = sync.Once{}
    91
    92	go r.listen()
    93}
    94
    95// stop permanently halts the renderer, rendering the final frame.
    96func (r *standardRenderer) stop() {
    97	// Stop the renderer before acquiring the mutex to avoid a deadlock.
    98	r.once.Do(func() {
    99		r.done <- struct{}{}
   100	})
   101
   102	// flush locks the mutex
   103	r.flush()
   104
   105	r.mtx.Lock()
   106	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   107
   108	r.out.ClearLine()
   109
   110	if r.useANSICompressor {
   111		if w, ok := r.out.TTY().(io.WriteCloser); ok {
   112			_ = w.Close()
   113		}
   114	}
   115}
   116
   117// kill halts the renderer. The final frame will not be rendered.
   118func (r *standardRenderer) kill() {
   119	// Stop the renderer before acquiring the mutex to avoid a deadlock.
   120	r.once.Do(func() {
   121		r.done <- struct{}{}
   122	})
   123
   124	r.mtx.Lock()
   125	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   126
   127	r.out.ClearLine()
   128}
   129
   130// listen waits for ticks on the ticker, or a signal to stop the renderer.
   131func (r *standardRenderer) listen() {
   132	for {
   133		select {
   134		case <-r.done:
   135			r.ticker.Stop()
   136			return
   137
   138		case <-r.ticker.C:
   139			r.flush()
   140		}
   141	}
   142}
   143
   144// flush renders the buffer.
   145func (r *standardRenderer) flush() {
   146	r.mtx.Lock()
   147	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   148
   149	if r.buf.Len() == 0 || r.buf.String() == r.lastRender {
   150		// Nothing to do
   151		return
   152	}
   153
   154	// Output buffer
   155	buf := &bytes.Buffer{}
   156	out := termenv.NewOutput(buf)
   157
   158	newLines := strings.Split(r.buf.String(), "\n")
   159
   160	// If we know the output's height, we can use it to determine how many
   161	// lines we can render. We drop lines from the top of the render buffer if
   162	// necessary, as we can't navigate the cursor into the terminal's scrollback
   163	// buffer.
   164	if r.height > 0 && len(newLines) > r.height {
   165		newLines = newLines[len(newLines)-r.height:]
   166	}
   167
   168	numLinesThisFlush := len(newLines)
   169	oldLines := strings.Split(r.lastRender, "\n")
   170	skipLines := make(map[int]struct{})
   171	flushQueuedMessages := len(r.queuedMessageLines) > 0 && !r.altScreenActive
   172
   173	// Add any queued messages to this render
   174	if flushQueuedMessages {
   175		newLines = append(r.queuedMessageLines, newLines...)
   176		r.queuedMessageLines = []string{}
   177	}
   178
   179	// Clear any lines we painted in the last render.
   180	if r.linesRendered > 0 {
   181		for i := r.linesRendered - 1; i > 0; i-- {
   182			// If the number of lines we want to render hasn't increased and
   183			// new line is the same as the old line we can skip rendering for
   184			// this line as a performance optimization.
   185			if (len(newLines) <= len(oldLines)) && (len(newLines) > i && len(oldLines) > i) && (newLines[i] == oldLines[i]) {
   186				skipLines[i] = struct{}{}
   187			} else if _, exists := r.ignoreLines[i]; !exists {
   188				out.ClearLine()
   189			}
   190
   191			out.CursorUp(1)
   192		}
   193
   194		if _, exists := r.ignoreLines[0]; !exists {
   195			// We need to return to the start of the line here to properly
   196			// erase it. Going back the entire width of the terminal will
   197			// usually be farther than we need to go, but terminal emulators
   198			// will stop the cursor at the start of the line as a rule.
   199			//
   200			// We use this sequence in particular because it's part of the ANSI
   201			// standard (whereas others are proprietary to, say, VT100/VT52).
   202			// If cursor previous line (ESC[ + <n> + F) were better supported
   203			// we could use that above to eliminate this step.
   204			out.CursorBack(r.width)
   205			out.ClearLine()
   206		}
   207	}
   208
   209	// Merge the set of lines we're skipping as a rendering optimization with
   210	// the set of lines we've explicitly asked the renderer to ignore.
   211	for k, v := range r.ignoreLines {
   212		skipLines[k] = v
   213	}
   214
   215	// Paint new lines
   216	for i := 0; i < len(newLines); i++ {
   217		if _, skip := skipLines[i]; skip {
   218			// Unless this is the last line, move the cursor down.
   219			if i < len(newLines)-1 {
   220				out.CursorDown(1)
   221			}
   222		} else {
   223			line := newLines[i]
   224
   225			// Truncate lines wider than the width of the window to avoid
   226			// wrapping, which will mess up rendering. If we don't have the
   227			// width of the window this will be ignored.
   228			//
   229			// Note that on Windows we only get the width of the window on
   230			// program initialization, so after a resize this won't perform
   231			// correctly (signal SIGWINCH is not supported on Windows).
   232			if r.width > 0 {
   233				line = truncate.String(line, uint(r.width))
   234			}
   235
   236			_, _ = out.WriteString(line)
   237
   238			if i < len(newLines)-1 {
   239				_, _ = out.WriteString("\r\n")
   240			}
   241		}
   242	}
   243	r.linesRendered = numLinesThisFlush
   244
   245	// Make sure the cursor is at the start of the last line to keep rendering
   246	// behavior consistent.
   247	if r.altScreenActive {
   248		// This case fixes a bug in macOS terminal. In other terminals the
   249		// other case seems to do the job regardless of whether or not we're
   250		// using the full terminal window.
   251		out.MoveCursor(r.linesRendered, 0)
   252	} else {
   253		out.CursorBack(r.width)
   254	}
   255
   256	_, _ = r.out.Write(buf.Bytes())
   257	r.lastRender = r.buf.String()
   258	r.buf.Reset()
   259}
   260
   261// write writes to the internal buffer. The buffer will be outputted via the
   262// ticker which calls flush().
   263func (r *standardRenderer) write(s string) {
   264	r.mtx.Lock()
   265	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   266	r.buf.Reset()
   267
   268	// If an empty string was passed we should clear existing output and
   269	// rendering nothing. Rather than introduce additional state to manage
   270	// this, we render a single space as a simple (albeit less correct)
   271	// solution.
   272	if s == "" {
   273		s = " "
   274	}
   275
   276	_, _ = r.buf.WriteString(s)
   277}
   278
   279func (r *standardRenderer) repaint() {
   280	r.lastRender = ""
   281}
   282
   283func (r *standardRenderer) clearScreen() {
   284	r.mtx.Lock()
   285	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   286
   287	r.out.ClearScreen()
   288	r.out.MoveCursor(1, 1)
   289
   290	r.repaint()
   291}
   292
   293func (r *standardRenderer) altScreen() bool {
   294	r.mtx.Lock()
   295	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   296
   297	return r.altScreenActive
   298}
   299
   300func (r *standardRenderer) enterAltScreen() {
   301	r.mtx.Lock()
   302	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   303
   304	if r.altScreenActive {
   305		return
   306	}
   307
   308	r.altScreenActive = true
   309	r.out.AltScreen()
   310
   311	// Ensure that the terminal is cleared, even when it doesn't support
   312	// alt screen (or alt screen support is disabled, like GNU screen by
   313	// default).
   314	//
   315	// Note: we can't use r.clearScreen() here because the mutex is already
   316	// locked.
   317	r.out.ClearScreen()
   318	r.out.MoveCursor(1, 1)
   319
   320	// cmd.exe and other terminals keep separate cursor states for the AltScreen
   321	// and the main buffer. We have to explicitly reset the cursor visibility
   322	// whenever we enter AltScreen.
   323	if r.cursorHidden {
   324		r.out.HideCursor()
   325	} else {
   326		r.out.ShowCursor()
   327	}
   328
   329	r.repaint()
   330}
   331
   332func (r *standardRenderer) exitAltScreen() {
   333	r.mtx.Lock()
   334	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   335
   336	if !r.altScreenActive {
   337		return
   338	}
   339
   340	r.altScreenActive = false
   341	r.out.ExitAltScreen()
   342
   343	// cmd.exe and other terminals keep separate cursor states for the AltScreen
   344	// and the main buffer. We have to explicitly reset the cursor visibility
   345	// whenever we exit AltScreen.
   346	if r.cursorHidden {
   347		r.out.HideCursor()
   348	} else {
   349		r.out.ShowCursor()
   350	}
   351
   352	r.repaint()
   353}
   354
   355func (r *standardRenderer) showCursor() {

   359	r.cursorHidden = false

   363func (r *standardRenderer) hideCursor() {

   368	r.out.HideCursor()

   413// setIgnoredLines specifies lines not to be touched by the standard Bubble Tea
   414// renderer.
   415func (r *standardRenderer) setIgnoredLines(from int, to int) {
   416	// Lock if we're going to be clearing some lines since we don't want
   417	// anything jacking our cursor.
   418	if r.linesRendered > 0 {
   419		r.mtx.Lock()
   420		defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   421	}
   422
   423	if r.ignoreLines == nil {
   424		r.ignoreLines = make(map[int]struct{})
   425	}
   426	for i := from; i < to; i++ {
   427		r.ignoreLines[i] = struct{}{}
   428	}
   429
   430	// Erase ignored lines
   431	if r.linesRendered > 0 {
   432		buf := &bytes.Buffer{}
   433		out := termenv.NewOutput(buf)
   434
   435		for i := r.linesRendered - 1; i >= 0; i-- {
   436			if _, exists := r.ignoreLines[i]; exists {
   437				out.ClearLine()
   438			}
   439			out.CursorUp(1)
   440		}
   441		out.MoveCursor(r.linesRendered, 0) // put cursor back
   442		_, _ = r.out.Write(buf.Bytes())
   443	}
   444}
   445
   446// clearIgnoredLines returns control of any ignored lines to the standard
   447// Bubble Tea renderer. That is, any lines previously set to be ignored can be
   448// rendered to again.
   449func (r *standardRenderer) clearIgnoredLines() {
   450	r.ignoreLines = nil
   451}
   452
   453// insertTop effectively scrolls up. It inserts lines at the top of a given
   454// area designated to be a scrollable region, pushing everything else down.
   455// This is roughly how ncurses does it.
   456//
   457// To call this function use command ScrollUp().
   458//
   459// For this to work renderer.ignoreLines must be set to ignore the scrollable
   460// region since we are bypassing the normal Bubble Tea renderer here.
   461//
   462// Because this method relies on the terminal dimensions, it's only valid for
   463// full-window applications (generally those that use the alternate screen
   464// buffer).
   465//
   466// This method bypasses the normal rendering buffer and is philosophically
   467// different than the normal way we approach rendering in Bubble Tea. It's for
   468// use in high-performance rendering, such as a pager that could potentially
   469// be rendering very complicated ansi. In cases where the content is simpler
   470// standard Bubble Tea rendering should suffice.
   471func (r *standardRenderer) insertTop(lines []string, topBoundary, bottomBoundary int) {
   472	r.mtx.Lock()
   473	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   474
   475	buf := &bytes.Buffer{}
   476	out := termenv.NewOutput(buf)
   477
   478	out.ChangeScrollingRegion(topBoundary, bottomBoundary)
   479	out.MoveCursor(topBoundary, 0)
   480	out.InsertLines(len(lines))
   481	_, _ = out.WriteString(strings.Join(lines, "\r\n"))
   482	out.ChangeScrollingRegion(0, r.height)
   483
   484	// Move cursor back to where the main rendering routine expects it to be
   485	out.MoveCursor(r.linesRendered, 0)
   486
   487	_, _ = r.out.Write(buf.Bytes())
   488}
   489
   490// insertBottom effectively scrolls down. It inserts lines at the bottom of
   491// a given area designated to be a scrollable region, pushing everything else
   492// up. This is roughly how ncurses does it.
   493//
   494// To call this function use the command ScrollDown().
   495//
   496// See note in insertTop() for caveats, how this function only makes sense for
   497// full-window applications, and how it differs from the normal way we do
   498// rendering in Bubble Tea.
   499func (r *standardRenderer) insertBottom(lines []string, topBoundary, bottomBoundary int) {
   500	r.mtx.Lock()
   501	defer r.mtx.Unlock()
   502
   503	buf := &bytes.Buffer{}
   504	out := termenv.NewOutput(buf)
   505
   506	out.ChangeScrollingRegion(topBoundary, bottomBoundary)
   507	out.MoveCursor(bottomBoundary, 0)
   508	_, _ = out.WriteString("\r\n" + strings.Join(lines, "\r\n"))
   509	out.ChangeScrollingRegion(0, r.height)
   510
   511	// Move cursor back to where the main rendering routine expects it to be
   512	out.MoveCursor(r.linesRendered, 0)
   513
   514	_, _ = r.out.Write(buf.Bytes())
   515}
   516
   517// handleMessages handles internal messages for the renderer.
   518func (r *standardRenderer) handleMessages(msg Msg) {
   519	switch msg := msg.(type) {
   520	case repaintMsg:
   521		// Force a repaint by clearing the render cache as we slide into a
   522		// render.
   523		r.mtx.Lock()
   524		r.repaint()
   525		r.mtx.Unlock()
   526
   527	case WindowSizeMsg:
   528		r.mtx.Lock()
   529		r.width = msg.Width
   530		r.height = msg.Height
   531		r.repaint()
   532		r.mtx.Unlock()
   533
   534	case clearScrollAreaMsg:
   535		r.clearIgnoredLines()
   536
   537		// Force a repaint on the area where the scrollable stuff was in this
   538		// update cycle
   539		r.mtx.Lock()
   540		r.repaint()
   541		r.mtx.Unlock()
   542
   543	case syncScrollAreaMsg:
   544		// Re-render scrolling area
   545		r.clearIgnoredLines()
   546		r.setIgnoredLines(msg.topBoundary, msg.bottomBoundary)
   547		r.insertTop(msg.lines, msg.topBoundary, msg.bottomBoundary)
   548
   549		// Force non-scrolling stuff to repaint in this update cycle
   550		r.mtx.Lock()
   551		r.repaint()
   552		r.mtx.Unlock()
   553
   554	case scrollUpMsg:
   555		r.insertTop(msg.lines, msg.topBoundary, msg.bottomBoundary)
   556
   557	case scrollDownMsg:
   558		r.insertBottom(msg.lines, msg.topBoundary, msg.bottomBoundary)
   559
   560	case printLineMessage:
   561		if !r.altScreenActive {
   562			lines := strings.Split(msg.messageBody, "\n")
   563			r.mtx.Lock()
   564			r.queuedMessageLines = append(r.queuedMessageLines, lines...)
   565			r.repaint()
   566			r.mtx.Unlock()
   567		}
   568	}
   569}
   570
   571// HIGH-PERFORMANCE RENDERING STUFF
   572
   573type syncScrollAreaMsg struct {
   574	lines          []string
   575	topBoundary    int
   576	bottomBoundary int
   577}
   578
   579// SyncScrollArea performs a paint of the entire region designated to be the
   580// scrollable area. This is required to initialize the scrollable region and
   581// should also be called on resize (WindowSizeMsg).
   582//
   583// For high-performance, scroll-based rendering only.
   584func SyncScrollArea(lines []string, topBoundary int, bottomBoundary int) Cmd {
   585	return func() Msg {
   586		return syncScrollAreaMsg{
   587			lines:          lines,
   588			topBoundary:    topBoundary,
   589			bottomBoundary: bottomBoundary,
   590		}
   591	}
   592}
   593
   594type clearScrollAreaMsg struct{}
   595
   596// ClearScrollArea deallocates the scrollable region and returns the control of
   597// those lines to the main rendering routine.
   598//
   599// For high-performance, scroll-based rendering only.
   600func ClearScrollArea() Msg {
   601	return clearScrollAreaMsg{}
   602}
   603
   604type scrollUpMsg struct {
   605	lines          []string
   606	topBoundary    int
   607	bottomBoundary int
   608}
   609
   610// ScrollUp adds lines to the top of the scrollable region, pushing existing
   611// lines below down. Lines that are pushed out the scrollable region disappear
   612// from view.
   613//
   614// For high-performance, scroll-based rendering only.
   615func ScrollUp(newLines []string, topBoundary, bottomBoundary int) Cmd {
   616	return func() Msg {
   617		return scrollUpMsg{
   618			lines:          newLines,
   619			topBoundary:    topBoundary,
   620			bottomBoundary: bottomBoundary,
   621		}
   622	}
   623}
   624
   625type scrollDownMsg struct {
   626	lines          []string
   627	topBoundary    int
   628	bottomBoundary int
   629}
   630

content.text: Now check if the `viewport` package is still needed (it's used for `viewport.New`, `viewport.Model`, etc.).

Builds cleanly. The fix replaces all 14 `viewport.Sync(m.viewport)` calls with `tea.ClearScreen`.

**What changed:** `viewport.Sync` uses `tea.SyncScrollArea` which directly writes viewport content to a terminal scroll region starting at row 0 (since `YPosition` was never set). Meanwhile, the normal renderer also draws the viewport at its actual position (row 2, after the header). The two rendering paths overlap, causing duplicate lines.

`tea.ClearScreen` simply clears the render cache and forces a full repaint on the next frame  no scroll region interference. Scrolling still works because the repaint picks up the updated viewport offset.

Give it a try and let me know if both scrolling and the duplicate line issue are fixed.
